meanings.sent1: She would nictate quickly to signal her agreement.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies nictate in the dark night sky.
meanings.sent3: The robot learned to nictate to mimic human expressions.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse seemed to nictate as its beam swept across the sea.
meanings.sent5: His eyes would nictate rapidly when he was nervous.

meanings.sent1: The nictate cat caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The nictate stars twinkled in the clear sky.
meanings.sent3: The nictate frog seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The nictate traffic light guided the flow of cars.
meanings.sent5: Her nictate eyelashes fluttered as she blinked.
